newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN PM SEES EU ROLE IN RENAULT CLOSURE CASE.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN PM SEES EU ROLE IN RENAULT CLOSURE CASE.

text.p: Belgian Prime Minister Jean-Luc Dehaene said on Monday the European Union should take measures to make surprise cross-border company closures such as the shutdown of car maker Renault's Belgian plant harder.
In a letter to European Commission chairman Jacques Santer Dehaene said EU rules should be tightened.

"The credibility of Europe is at stake. Europe should not just work on expanding the single market, but also work on firm social and employment policies," Dehaene said. Europe needed clear rules on fiscal harmonisation and for disinvestments.

Renault last Thursday announced out of the blue it would close its Vilvoorde car assembly plant in July, costing 3,100 Belgian Renault workers and 1,000 workers at suppliers and subcontractors their jobs.
Dehaene later told a meeting on the single currency that "Individual countries are powerless in the face of cross-border operations. Only coordinated action on a European level can bring any relief."
In the letter to Santer he said Renault's decision to shut the Vilvoorde plant had hit Belgium "at a particularly tough time with respect to unemployment."
